entry.summary: The following message is transmitted at the request of the Chugach National Forest Avalanche Center. ...THE CHUGACH NATIONAL FOREST AVALANCHE CENTER HAS ISSUED AN AVALANCHE WARNING FOR THE FOLLOWING AREAS... entry.title: Flood Watch issued March 21 at 9:06PM MST until March 22 at 1:00PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: .Heavy rain continues to fall across the region with some of the rain falling on snow. This is leading to increased flows in waterways. Several creeks and waterways have reached critical levels. Additional rises in river, creek, and stream levels are expected. Be aware that Flood Warnings and Advisories are in effect for portions of central and northern Arizona.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 21 at 6:11PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Ice Jam flooding on rivers and streams possible... Ice is beginning to break up on area waterways, with ice jams reported on portions of the Yellowstone River and Powder River. With warm temperatures in the forecast, ice will begin to break up in more area waterways. As the ice breaks up it may become piled up resulting in an ice jam and localized flooding.
